dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So how could I not know about this?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

Suddenly-- --the BLACKHAWK CHOPPER drops down directly in front of Marcus, hovering a few feet above the water, the GUNNER pointing his weapon directly at Marcus (he's one of the two soldiers we saw before). The BLADE WASH swirls the water in a whirlpool and beats back the FIRE behind Marcus. As the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: below the surface, BULLETS ZINGING through the murky water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is winged by a couple of shots, his thermoplastic flesh getting torn apart--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - He pauses a moment, squinting into the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: for a glimpse of Marcus, but failing to register that--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: right beneath him, the WATER ROILS as if teeming with piranha. Suddenly--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from the RIVER with a hideous BUZZING SOUND. Hydrobots resemble segmented serpents, eyeless, but with razor-sharp heads that DRILL into their victims-- they respond to sound and vibrations. About a dozen of these four- foot long, glistening steel snakes shoot from the water to attack the chopper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HYDROBOTS PIERCE the aluminum FLOOR, and shoot into the cabin, the PILOT and the two SOLDIERS CRY OUT. The GUNNER tumbles out of the chopper and FALLS in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: attempts to maintain control, but the hydraulics are damaged and the steel serpents thrash about in the cabin. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: surfaces, trying frantically to swim to shore. But the hydrobots are upon him, he SHRIEKS and disappears beneath the bubbling surface, which now boils with BLOOD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - A WHIRRING HYDROBOT penetrates the other soldier's leg. He SCREAMS and wrenches the thing back out, tossing it from the chopper just before--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaps from the cabin and makes it to shore, where he collapses. But the remaining, wounded SOLDIER can't get out of the hip-deep water before the HYDROBOTS are upon him. Suddenly, HANDS BURST from the water, grabbing the soldier. A second later, MARCUS SURFACES, slinging the man over his shoulder. He strides to shore, as if rescuing the man from enemy fire, hydrobots thrashing and bubbling at his waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches the amazed pilot, lays the wounded soldier down beside him, then tears a whirring, writhing HYDROBOT from the soldier's belly and WHIPS its head against a ROCK-- it SPARKS, micro-machine parts fly. The pilot and wounded soldier stare at him, astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses the dead robo-snake aside, then turns and moves back into the water, quickly vanishing below the surface.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't mention it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: moves steadily across the silty river bottom. He doesn't need air. HYDROBOTS come at him, he swats them away as if they were mosquitoes, CRUSHING in his hand those that linger too long. Those which make contact with his artificial skin can't get far, turn and swim off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emerges, the FLAMES still visible on the other side of the river, behind him. He doesn't look back, as he moves into Skynet turf. This side of the river isn't wooded, everything has a concrete, industrial feel. Marcus is a mess, both clothing and skin are shredded and charred. He nearly bumps into a SKELETAL STEEL TERMINATOR, which emerges from behind a concrete wall. The terminator trains its PLASMA RIFLE on MARCUS, scans him, RED EYES glowing... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is TARGETED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the side, the HIGHLIGHTED WORDS "NON-ORGANIC -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns from MARCUS, no longer interested, moving off on its preprogrammed patrol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves up a sloping, CONCRETE EMBANKMENT.   At the top of the rise, he sees, spread out before him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a hideous industrial sprawl, OPEN GAS FLAMES, SMOKING FACTORIES, rumbling VEHICLES, H-Ks, TERMINATOR TROOPS on patrol. Nothing green, a GREY HAZE hangs over the landscape. After a moment, MARCUS shakes his head and gamely soldiers on, moving along the edge of the elevated embankment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves past banks of ANTI-AIRCRAFT guns and MISSILE LAUNCHERS, interspersed with slowly rotating RADAR TRACKING DISHES-- the first line of defense. From this fortress-like wall he descends into the nightmarish environment beyond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reacts to a CAWING SOUND above, looks up to see--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: perching on an overhead WIRE.   A second later--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A BLUE PLASMA PULSE blasts the thing to smithereens, a few BLACK FEATHERS drift down as-- --a T-400 (same mask-like face we saw earlier) lowers its plasma weapon and strolls on. Target practice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stays out of the way of the TERMINATOR LEGIONS patrolling near the riverside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: heads inland, past the ruins of a CHURCH-- WALLS with the remains of stained glass WINDOWS, STATUES OF SAINTS. Hearing RUMBLING NOISES, Marcus hurries out of the way as-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: collapses, pushed down by an automated SKYNET BULLDOZER. This gigantic, self-operated construction machine has a swivelling CAMERA HEAD instead of a cab. Its giant
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: roll over the STONE STATUES, crushing them to dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: keeps moving into Skynet's turf. The demolition gives way to massive CONSTRUCTION, as the robots remake the human world in their own image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: erect a low-slung STEEL FRAME structure, automated CRANES and SUPPLY TRUCKS about. These robots are oversized versions of the steel terminators we know, but with multiple limbs bearing WELDING TOOLS, and TREADS instead of legs. Marcus watches as BEAMS are quickly welded into place by telescoping steel arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: continues into the completed robot city. Skynet's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is featureless, bland, purely practical: single- story, windowless CONCRETE or STEEL structures with massive open DOORWAYS to accommodate their largest machines. A RED GLOW emanates from the interiors, the robots' preferred lighting scheme. No sidewalks or signs, just thick GRIDS of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and PIPES overhead. Constant NOISE of BUZZING POWER, RATTLING MACHINES, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps inside one of these buildings--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This TERMINATOR ASSEMBLY PLANT is an intricate, multi-leveled clockwork maze of moving CONVEYORS and INDUSTRIAL ROBOTICS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and HYDRAULICS are ROBOTICALLY SOLDERED in place.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TERMINATOR PARTS-- TORSOS, FACE PLATES, SPINAL COLUMNS, LIMBS

direction.raw_text: stamp out TERMINATOR PARTS-- TORSOS, FACE PLATES, SPINAL COLUMNS, LIMBS. Partially-completed PARTS are moved by CONVEYOR to ASSEMBLY STATIONS, where LIMBS and HEADS are JOINED to TORSOS, elaborate OPERATIONS carried out by INDUSTRIAL ROBOTS, like the ones in present-day factories. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is SPRAYED OVER a METAL ENDOSKELETON in precise amounts, building up to create human features... this is a T-400. An INDUSTRIAL ROBOT ARM picks up a CPU from a DRY-ICE CONTAINER. The CPU features the distinctive, linked rectangles familiar from the earlier films. The arm lifts this gingerly to a TERMINATOR SKELETON and INSERTS IT into the STEEL SKULL, SCREWING A SEAL over the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flicker to life, and THE ARMATURE releases the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which moves away under its own power. It removes a PLASMA WEAPON from a WALL RACK, moving past-- --the dumbfounded MARCUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: joins a dozen identical robots, who ride on a treaded SKYNET TANK with a PLASMA CANNON and FLAMETHROWER. There are numerous TANKS here, awaiting deployment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rounding a corner on a straight, narrow street, MARCUS sees all the ROBOTS and SMALL VEHICLES clearing into small NICHES built into the walls on either side, as if clearing a path for him. It takes him a moment to realize it's not him they're responding to-- a RUMBLE BUILDS... A convoy of GIGANTIC SKYNET TRUCKS-- a half-dozen modified
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now driven by CPUS-- bear down on MARCUS at extremely high speed. They carry construction supplies: massive STEEL BEAMS, CONCRETE PIPES, etc. And there's barely inches of clearance on either side. These things aren't slowing down. There's nowhere for Marcus to duck out of the way. He has no choice but to RUN, as fast as he can, the lead vehicle gaining on him rapidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to the concrete in the middle of the street, pressing his body flat as the LEAD TRUCK passes over him, the wheels missing him by inches. But he has only a moment's respite. THE NEXT TRUCK has a lower undercarriage, a steel CROSSMEMBER catches his back-- --and DRAGS MARCUS beneath the vehicle, ripping off chunks of flesh. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Marcus CRIES OUT, crawls ahead and clings to a forward portion of the undercarriage, keeping himself just above the pavement. His LEFT LEG, twisted and damaged, still drags on the asphalt, throwing up SPARKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CAMERA PULLS BACK straight above the MOVING VEHICLE, amidst the convoy speeding down this sunken artery. CAMERA KEEPS MOVING UPWARD to reveal an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW of Skynet's city. Seen from above, the rectilinear STRUCTURES, criss-crossing POWER LINES and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: strongly resemble a PULSING CIRCUIT BOARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves grimly down a narrow, steel passageway,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He reaches the MP, outside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MP looks a little surprised, but says nothing.    He undoes the LATCH on the door and opens it for Connor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I need to talk to the prisoner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A bare, windowless space with only a cot, a metal chair and a bedpan. BLAIR looks up, bleary-eyed, exhausted and scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gestures for the MP to close the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair's mighty impressed, in spite of the circumstances.       She leaps to her feet, stands at attention and salutes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant Williams. I'm sorry about the way you've been treated, but we're forced to take every precaution. I'm John Connor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At ease.   Please, sit. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: pulls up the chair, close to Blair, who sits on the bed. His tone is careful, controlled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Connor blinks at this, alert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair picks up on his interest, but doesn't understand it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I've gone over your record, lieutenant. You're a good soldier, flown a lot of missions... (BEAT) Why in God's name would you help a terminator escape?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir-- he isn't a terminator.     He's human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We know he's crossed into Skynet territory, why would he do that if he isn't--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's trying to find his friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What friends?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A couple of kids. They were taken in a Skynet transport, probably to some kind of prison camp-- he said their names were Star and Kyle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kyle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mm... Kyle something.    With an `R.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Reese.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it.     How did you...? (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is already on his feet, BANGING on the door-- the MP unlatches it to let him out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Partway down the hallway, CONNOR encounters KATE, who walks with him, takes in his expression.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is it, John?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I always knew I'd have to find him someday. I just didn't know how.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?   Find who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on KYLE'S HAND, clutching STAR'S tightly.   We hear them SINGING faintly, together:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Twinkle, twinkle, little star...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R, their heads, feet and chests are clamped onto SLIDING TRAYS, a long row of these hold OTHER PRISONERS as well. Kyle and Star must reach across a gap between the trays to hold hands. (It's the first time we've seen her hatless.) The trays are all poised before panel-covered SEMI-CIRCULAR OPENINGS built into the wall, in a sterile, hospital-like environment. Above each opening is a MONITOR SCREEN. An ominous HUM is building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: visible through GLASS WALLS, MEDICAL LASERS mounted on ROBOTIC ARMS work on anesthetized patients (we needn't see the grisly details).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and KYLE, the PANELS OPEN, the trays slowly SLIDE into the OPENINGS. SCREAMS and SOBS from other prisoners. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kyle and Star hold hands for as long as possible, then release their grip as their bodies enter the chambers and the panels slide shut.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no, oh no...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shh, keep singing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Immobilized in this small, tubular chamber, like an MRI, STAR closes her eyes as she's bathed in BRIGHT LIGHT, LASER GRIDS projecting over her skull. The HUMMING is LOUDER.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Up above the world so high, like a diamond in the sky...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The same thing is happening to Kyle.    He's no longer singing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it stop it STOP IT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: beneath the truck. He's moved to the edge of the chassis, near a WHEEL, moving slowly, carefully. There's a bit more clearance at the sides of the sunken highway now, but they're still moving awfully fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the vehicle suddenly SLOWS to negotiate a turn, braking downhill. Marcus seizes this opportunity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as MARCUS LAUNCHES himself from below the vehicle, rolling into the GAP between the convoy and the concrete wall. The remaining vehicles RUMBLE PAST, as MARCUS presses himself against the wall. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : When they're gone, he gets to his feet, limping down the highway on foot for a short distance, dragging his damaged leg behind him. He hears ANOTHER CONVOY approaching. Just in time, he finds a SEAM in the poured concrete, it's enough to give him purchase-- he struggles to climb up the eight feet of freeway wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes it over the top, TRUCKS RUMBLING past below. This is desolate, hilly country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN - among the vehicles below is a CONTAINER, like the one that held Kyle and Star. We glimpse the anguished
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and REACHING HANDS of CAPTIVES within.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reacts, moves as fast as he can alongside the trucks for a short distance until--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shoot ahead around a curve and out of sight.      In the distance is a COMPLEX OF BUILDINGS, clearly the destination. Marcus begins moving along the edge of the freeway, heading for the complex. He reaches the edge of a plateau, looks down, his expression changing. This is the last thing he expected to see. CAMERA MOVES to reveal--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a panoramic view of a GORGEOUS COASTAL COMMUNITY. The place is lush, green, with well-maintained, lovely HOMES in the distance, a BLUE SEA beyond. The complex of buildings stands a few miles away, at the far end of the valley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: amazed, limps down a gentle slope leading to this seeming paradise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   GOLF COURSE - DAY MARCUS emerges from a small stand of trees and finds himself looking at a groomed FAIRWAY. Marcus hears a NOISE nearby-- --a GOLF BALL bouncing on the ground not far away.    MARCUS turns in the direction it came from. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : An electric GOLF CART approaches, driven by a handsome, middle-aged golfer-- JEREMY-- who wears casual country club attire, eating from a clear BAG OF TRAIL MIX. Jeremy comes to a stop beside Marcus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus slowly shakes his head, as Jeremy climbs out of the cart, looking him over carefully, taking in the exposed metal at his shoulder and leg.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look like you've been hit by a truck--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Among other things. Look, I'm trying to find some friends-- a couple of kids. They were taken here, I saw some buildings--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: eyes him, a little surprised at his ignorance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus hesitates a beat, can he trust this guy? But Jeremy simply seems eager to help, as he guides him to the passenger seat, then gets behind the wheel. With a smile:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He extends a hand.     After a beat, Marcus reaches toward it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeremy clutches Marcus' hand tightly.     Marcus blinks, Jeremy cocks his head, then lets go. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The facility, sure.   Hop in, I'll take you there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) This round was gonna blow my handicap anyway. I'm Jeremy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marcus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: With that, he hits the gas.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't connect with you at all... your interface must've been damaged. Don't worry, soon they'll have you as good as new.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: drives the cart down the road, past well-kept homes with generous lawns-- it's a beautiful, upscale community at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BICYCLISTS and FUTURISTIC CARS pass, Jeremy waves to NEIGHBORS. Marcus takes it all in with disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds the plastic bag out to Marcus, who obligingly takes a handful of trail mix, pops it in his mouth. After a beat, he spits it back out in his hand, stares at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus stares at him, confused. Jeremy is starting to realize just how out of it he is, speaks as if to a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus just stares, Jeremy gestures at the world around them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't think there was-- anything like this left... anywhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.   We're very lucky.   Want some?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't food.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, of course not. Seems you got a little memory loss going on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It's a foam resin. It can taste like anything you want it to-- but of course, we don't really need to eat. (BEAT) Our brains are powered by fuel cells, remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As he speaks, he notices his BAG is nearly empty. He casually lifts his sport shirt and CLICKS OPEN a PANEL beneath his rib cage. We glimpse CIRCUITS, FIBER-OPTICS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From within he removes an identical BAG FILLED with TRAIL MIX (the stuff he just ate), and replaces it with the empty bag. He clicks the panel shut again, pops a NUT in his mouth. Marcus stares at this, appalled, then blinks and looks away. He reacts to the sound of PIANO MUSIC, a difficult piece being played expertly-- PASSING a PICTURE WINDOW, he sees a
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) We're in a transitional phase. Most of us need the comfort of the familiar a little while longer-- food, shelter, sex. Until we forget the old life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Eating-- well, chewing-- it's one of the hardest habits to break... but before long, none of this will be necessary. We won't even need these bodies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: practicing. In front of this home, a GARDENER and WINDOW WASHER are hard at work. They're both T-400s, with the eerie mask-like faces. Marcus reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeremy winces, as if at a racial epithet. He's starting to regret giving Marcus a lift, his manner is careful, as if he'd picked up some homeless guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus grabs Jeremy, who pulls back a bit, alarmed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Terminators!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't call them that here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A hybrid.    The same as you. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: For a moment, Jeremy's expression darkens.     Then he shuts his eyes, and his features relax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeremy nods and SMILES, looking at him once more.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A hybrid-- human and machine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. That's what this community is for-- people like us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus... why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should be grateful to have been chosen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about the ones who weren't?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean like Janet and the kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your family. You lost them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Why are you smiling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: `Cause I feel good. The interface recognizes negative emotions-- rage, grief, despair-- and stimulates positive endorphins in response. Thank God, life would be pretty unbearable otherwise, don't you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They've left the main street now, driving down a WOODED PATH leading to the "facility." There are lawns, fountains, etc. Marcus SLAMS ON the brakes, then clutches Jeremy by the throat-- the man looks more annoyed than frightened. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus drags the man from the cart by his throat, squeezing harder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus releases him, but remains in his face.       Jeremy takes a moment to recover his composure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He taps his own eye with an audible CLICK, not flinching. Marcus takes a couple steps away, looking at his own hands. Jeremy points to nearby BUILDINGS, a little peevish. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me everything.   How did you people get here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Most of us worked at NASA or DARPA. I was an engineer on Project Angel--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Angel-- what is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Advanced Nexus of Genetic and Electronic Life-forms... A-N-G-E-L. You can stop choking me, it's not like I need to breathe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) We replaced the body's hydrocarbons with plastinated compounds while maintaining cellular structure-- analog neural impulses were converted to wireless digital signals, controlling the micro-tech chassis--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: English!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs, slowly) The goal was a superior support system for the human brain-- to go anywhere, do anything-- explore deep space, the bottom of the sea. I specialized in optics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: So saying, he's back in the cart, pulling away in a hurry.   A moment later, Marcus moves off amongst the trees. Nearing the complex, Marcus reacts to BIRDSONG above.   He looks up, stops as he sees-- --a TINY SPEAKER, concealed amongst the LEAVES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) The facility is just ahead. I'll let them know you're coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: moves to this tree, touches it-- the bark feels unnatural. He RAPS it with his FIST-- it sounds hollow, made of FIBERGLAS. He fingers a LEAF, tries to bend it-- PLASTIC. He crouches, studying the GRASS. After a moment, he finds a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the pristine lawn. He starts to peel it up... it's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Beneath it is SANDY DIRT. Marcus KEEPS PEELING the plastic covering back... more dirt-- and BITS OF BONE. As he continues to uncover the ground we see recognizable CHUNKS of SKULLS, LEGBONES, etc. By now he's rolled back a few square yards, numb with horror. Marcus moves on toward the complex with new determination, trying to stay out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: above the long row of chambers-- colorful 3-D IMAGES of the prisoner's BRAINS are being constructed, like
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scans. DENSE DIGITAL READ-OUTS BELOW, as data is analyzed. (Levels of seratonin, endorphins, etc.) Beside these are BARCODES and small INSET PHOTOS taken within the chamber, the subjects looking frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the LASERS are still now, their grisly work done for the moment, awaiting the next batch. An ENGINEER, a nice-looking, well-built young man in loose black clothing, moves down the row of chambers, studying results. He speaks into a subtle HEAD-SET: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he speaks, the BARCODES on the monitors in question turn either RED or GREEN in response to his judgments. He reaches KYLE'S CHAMBER, we see Kyle's anguished FACE on the monitor photograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kyle gets a GREEN BARCODE, the engineer is on to Star, he strokes his chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On STAR'S MONITOR-- RED BARCODE. The engineer KICKS something on the floor, bends down to pick it up-- STAR'S BASEBALL CAP. He flings it expertly into-- --a nearby TRASH RECEPTACLE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: - acceptable. 32579 - no, insufficient neural capacity.
dialogue.name: dialogue
